data.title: EARL: Exoplanet Analytic Reflected Lightcurves package
data.name: EARL
data.description: Exoplanet Analytic Reflected Lightcurves (EARL): This Mathematica code allows you to compute the analytic form of a reflected lightcurve given a spherical harmonic decomposition of the planet albedo map and the viewing and orbital geometries. The theoretical foundation for this code is laid out in the paper "Analytic Reflected Lightcurves for Exoplanets" by Hal M. Haggard and Nicolas B. Cowan, which can be found the arXiv.

evidence: "This Mathematica notebook allows you to compute the analytic form of a reflected lightcurve given a spherical harmonic decomposition of the planet albedo map and the viewing and orbital geometries."
"Exoplanet Analytic Reflected Lightcurves (EARL): This Mathematica notebook allows you to compute..." (indicates a research analysis tool, not a general-purpose library)
The README describes only the Mathematica notebook itself with no mention of package managers, binaries, or containers, implying distribution directly via the source notebook in the repository.
